SEARCH
Package pegasus.pointer

Class ArrayPointer<T>

java.lang.Object
pegasus.pointer.ArrayPointer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of object to reference
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<T>, BasePointer<T>, ObjectPointer<T>, IndexedIterable<T>
public class ArrayPointer<T> extends Object implements ObjectPointer<T>
An array-based generic pointer.
See Also:
  • ObjectPointer
  • Serialized Form

      public <U> ObjectPointer<U> map(Function<? super T,? extends U> mapper)

    • cast

      public <U> ObjectPointer<U> cast(Class<? extends U> target) throws ClassCastException
      Casts the internal array of this pointer to an array of the provided target class, then returns a pointer to the cast array. The resulting pointer will reference the same array as this pointer.
      Specified by:
      cast in interface ObjectPointer<T>
      Type Parameters:
      U - The class of which to cast to
      Parameters:
      target - The target class of which to cast to
      Returns:
      The cast pointer
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - When the values of this pointer are not an instance of the provided class U
      NullPointerException - When the provided target class is null

    • merge

      public <U, V> ObjectPointer<V> merge(ObjectPointer<U> p, BiFunction<? super T,? super U,? extends V> merger) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException
      Applies the provided merger function to each corresponding pair of values between this pointer and the provided pointer p, then returns a new pointer whose values are populated from that of the return values of the provided merger function.
      Specified by:
      merge in interface ObjectPointer<T>
      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of object to merge this pointer with
      V - The type of object to merge the pointers to
      Parameters:
      p - The pointer of which to merge this pointer with
      merger - The merger function of which to handle the merging of the two pointers
      Returns:
      The resulting pointer
      Throws:
      IncompatibleDimensionsException - When the pointers' sizes are different
      NullPointerException - When either the provided pointer p or the provided merger function is null

    • resize

      public ObjectPointer<T> resize(int size)
      Returns a new pointer with of the provided size whose values are populated from that of this pointer's values, trimmed or padded with null values as necessary.
      Specified by:
      resize in interface ObjectPointer<T>
      Parameters:
      size - The size of which to resize to

    • reverse

      public void reverse()
      Reverses the order of this pointer. For instance, the pointer ["hello", "world"] will become ["world", "hello"].
      Specified by:
      reverse in interface ObjectPointer<T>
